page.title: 05SHOPPING IN THE CLUNTON AREA
page.content: The block is sadly devoid of shops. Although Clunton is a fairly large village it's shop has been closed for over a year because it wasn't financially viable. It is possible however to buy goat's milk and cheese from the Goat Farm in Clunton and no-one need ever be short of an egg as several people have boards advertising the sale of free range eggs. In addition it is possible to buy ice-cream and homemade jam from Bush Farm which is a small but popular caravan site. On Friday the postmistress from Hopesay holds a Post Office at the Crown Inn at Clunton which saves many pensioners and the odd Mum the journey to the nearest office two miles away. It also acts as a meeting place for people who might not otherwise see one another all week.
